fields.name: South Carolina
fields.description: South Carolina is a southeastern U.S. state known for coastal beaches, historic towns, and palmetto tree symbolism.

fields.name: Tennessee
fields.description: Tennessee is known for country music, the Great Smoky Mountains, and strong cultural ties to American music history.

fields.name: Kentucky
fields.description: Kentucky is known for horse racing, bourbon, bluegrass music, and the Appalachian Mountains.

fields.name: Virginia
fields.description: Virginia played a major role in early U.S. history and features coastal plains, mountains, and historical sites.

fields.name: West Virginia
fields.description: West Virginia is known for its rugged mountains, coal mining history, and outdoor recreation.

fields.name: Maryland
fields.description: Maryland borders Washington D.C. and is known for the Chesapeake Bay, seafood, and colonial history.

fields.name: Massachusetts
fields.description: Massachusetts is a historic New England state known for colonial history, universities, and technology hubs.

fields.name: Vermont
fields.description: Vermont is known for its forests, maple syrup, small towns, and rural New England charm.

fields.name: Maine
fields.description: Maine features rugged coastlines, lighthouses, seafood, and vast northern forests.

fields.name: New York
fields.description: New York includes NYC, one of the world's major cultural and financial centers, along with forests and mountains.

fields.name: Pennsylvania
fields.description: Pennsylvania is known for Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, colonial history, and Amish communities.

fields.name: Michigan
fields.description: Michigan is surrounded by the Great Lakes and known for car manufacturing and outdoor recreation.

fields.name: Texas
fields.description: Texas is the second-largest U.S. state, known for its diverse landscapes, energy industry, and strong identity.

fields.name: Nevada
fields.description: Nevada is known for Las Vegas, desert landscapes, mining history, and wide open spaces.

fields.name: Wyoming
fields.description: Wyoming is known for Yellowstone, the Tetons, cowboy culture, and wide plains.

fields.name: Oregon
fields.description: Oregon is known for forests, coastline, the Cascade Range, and outdoor-focused culture.

fields.name: New Mexico
fields.description: New Mexico blends Native American and Hispanic heritage and is known for deserts, adobe architecture, and art communities.
